definitions.definition: the tube in the body through which food passes when it leaves the stomach

examples.text: It can take up to 72 hours for food to pass through the gut.
I had a terrible pain in my guts after eating too many plums.

definitions.definition: the organs in and around the stomach, especially in an animal

examples.text: I'll only cook fish if the guts have been removed.
I don't like movies that are full of blood and guts *(= that show a lot of blood and violence)*.

definitions.definition: a person’s stomach, especially when it is large

examples.text: He had a bit of a gut on him, but otherwise he was quite skinny.
a **beer gut** *(= caused by drinking a lot of beer regularly)*

definitions.definition: the courage and strength of mind that it takes to do something difficult or unpleasant

examples.text: He **doesn't have the guts** to walk away from a well-paid job.
It takes guts to keep on running even though you have blistered feet.
She had the guts to stand up to the school bully.

definitions.definition: the place where your natural feelings that make you react in a particular way are thought to be

examples.text: I had a feeling in my guts that something was wrong.

definitions.definition: the most important part of something
thin strong string made from animals' intestines and used in making musical instruments, tennis rackets and medical equipment
to make a great effort to do something

examples.text: It’s a problem which nobody is going to bust a gut trying to solve.
I busted my chops to get into law school.
These guys were busting their butts on the field, trying to excel at athletics.

definitions.definition: to make a decision based on something that you are certain about, even though you do not have any direct proof and cannot explain why you are certain

examples.text: I went with my gut and turned down the job.

definitions.definition: used to refer to somebody who eats too much

examples.text: Make sure greedy guts doesn’t eat all the cake.

definitions.definition: to be very angry with somebody and punish them severely for something they have done

examples.text: She’ll have your guts for garters if she ever finds out.

definitions.definition: to work very hard to achieve something

examples.text: I slogged my guts out for the exam.

definitions.definition: to tell somebody everything you know or feel about something, because you are upset

examples.text: He has spilled his guts in his new autobiography.

wordOrigin: Old English guttas (plural), probably related to gēotan ‘pour’.
